![](https://townofanthonytx.org/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=YuunAOmmfZTwXLc8A9J%2FHyurjO1JQGQ0CmtkuhNkvMyZHlFi6GCMfYEMuRY4wsRp&s=large)
Sally Alfaro
Head Court Clerk
(915) 886-3272

amc@townofanthonytx.org

401 Wildcat Dr., Anthony TX, 79821

Sally Alfaro has devoted more than fifteen years of service to the Town of Anthony,
where she currently holds the position of Head Court Clerk for the Anthony Municipal
Court. In this role, she oversees the effective management of court operations, maintains
precise records, and ensures adherence to municipal and state judicial procedures.
A lifelong resident of Anthony, Texas, Ms. Alfaro began her career with the Rio Grande
Council of Governments, gaining valuable experience in public administration and
regional governance. Before joining the Town of Anthony, she also worked as a legal
secretary, where she developed extensive knowledge of legal documentation, case
management, and courtroom processes.
Throughout her years of public service, Ms. Alfaro has shown a steadfast commitment to
justice, transparency, and professionalism within the municipal court system. Her
dedication and deep institutional knowledge continue to be invaluable to the Town of
Anthony and its residents.
![](https://townofanthonytx.org/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=th9%252BfRHR9ycHJ%252B75pA1xF7Wb3Nyf2RFsuJlL7cwdD8jjy4FpCkDu0niH3jz%2F%252BrJz2aCn9gIHUx6nw%252BXwEb9BKg%3D%3D&s=large)
Eunice Reyes
City Judge
(915) 886-3272

ereyes@townofanthonytx.org

PO Box 1269, Anthony TX, 79821

Judge Eunice Reyes proudly serves as the Municipal Court Judge for the City of Anthony, Texas bringing a deep commitment to fairness, integrity, and justice. Judge Reyes presides over a wide range of cases including traffic violations, misdemeanor offenses, city ordinance matters, and other municipal legal issues.
With a legal career spanning over 12 years, Judge Reyes has built a reputation for professionalism, impartiality, and a thoughtful approach to the law. Judge Reyes is also an attorney in private practice attorney, where she has gained extensive courtroom experience and a strong understanding of municipal law.
Judge Reyes is a graduate of Thomas M. Cooley School of Law. She is actively involved in American Inns of Courts, JPD Drug Court, and El Paso Magistrate Court.
Dedicated to upholding the law with fairness and respect for all individuals, Judge Reyes strives to ensure that the Municipal Court remains accessible, efficient, and responsive to the needs of the community.
![](https://townofanthonytx.org/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=ajuZnZbc9nBK8sVwSZJU75fPtBuR0gbAyyOci6YpFBRyZ10V7yHL%252BKyMqY23aqn4&s=large)
Daniel Robledo
City Prosecutor

PO Box 1269, Anthony TX, 79821

Born and raised in El Paso, Texas, Daniel Robledo is a proud son of Eduviges Briones Robledo (Duve) and Justo Ricardo Robledo (Tito), a decorated WWII Combat Army Veteran "1st Division “The Big Red One.”
​
Mr. Robledo is a graduate from Bel-Air High School in 1979; earned his Bachelor’s Degree in Criminal Justice from the University of Texas at El Paso in 1984; received his Juris Doctor in Law from Thurgood Marshall School of Law, Houston, Texas, in 1987.
In 1987, at the age of 26, Mr. Robledo passed the Texas State Bar Exam., and has been practicing law, with over 38 years of experience, as an attorney.
Mr. Robledo served as a Part-Time Assistant City Prosecutor for the City of El Paso, Texas for 12 years from 1988 to 2001.
Mr. Robledo was also Appointed Judge for the City of Horizon Municipal Court, Texas and served as Judge from 1998 to 2001.
Mr. Robledo then was Elected as Judge for the City of El Paso Municipal Court Number Five in 2001 and served as Judge until January of 2025.
Mr. Robledo, was appointed City Prosecutor for the City of Anthony, Texas since January 2025, with 37 years of Municipal Court experience.
Mr. Robledo is licensed to practice law in The State of Texas; Federal Court in the Western District of Texas; Federal Court in the District of Arizona and The United States Claims Court.
